abstract: The best of long-form journalism this week.
snippet: The best of long-form journalism this week.
lead_paragraph: Tehelka writes about the tussle between the government and India's news media, particularly its cable news channels. Ashok Malik writes that the government  now "fears the media more than it does the opposition." The government's efforts to rein in the media have faltered, even as news outlets have become more shrill and unethical, he says. Vinod Mehta, the editor of Outlook magazine, tells Mr. Malik: "Transgressions of the media, in style and in content, are growing. The atmosphere of polemics and name calling is distorting national debate."
